edu.kit.cm.kitcampusguide.standardtypes
Class Building

java.lang.Object
  edu.kit.cm.kitcampusguide.standardtypes.Building
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Building
extends Object
implements Serializable

Represents a building. Stores the maps representing the floors, which of these is the ground floor and the POI representing the building. A building is unique, so creating a building with the same id leads to an error. Therefore buildings should best be initialized at or from one central source, and afterwards only used with getBuildingByID.

Author:
fred
See Also:

Constructor Detail

Building

public Building(int id,
                List<Map> floors,
                int groundfloorIndex,
                POI buildingPOI)
         throws IllegalArgumentException
Constructs a new building. The building needs the parameters id, floors, groundfloorIndex and buildingPOI.

Parameters:
id - The id of the building, needs to be unique.
floors - The maps representing the floors from lowest to highest.
groundfloorIndex - The index of the ground floor in floors. Is tested to be in range of floors.
buildingPOI - The POI representing the building. Required to be not null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If a duplicate ID is given.
Method Detail

getID

public int getID()
Returns the ID of the building. This id is unique, and can therefore be used in combination with getBuildingByID(int) to get a specific building.

Returns:
The ID of the building.

getFloors

public List<Map> getFloors()
Returns the maps representing the floors of the building. This list is ordered from the top floor down. To identify the ground floor, use getGroundFloorIndex(), or use getGroundFloor() to get its map directly.

Returns:
The maps representing the floors of the building.

getGroundFloorIndex

public int getGroundFloorIndex()
Returns the index of the ground floor in the list gotten by getFloors. Use this in combination with getFloors to identify the map of the ground floor.

Returns:
The index of the ground floor in the list gotten by getFloors.

getBuildingPOI

public POI getBuildingPOI()
Returns the POI representing the building. This POI normally is jumped to (in the view) show after this building is left. To access the building, use the building-variable in a POI.

Returns:
The POI representing the building.

getBuildingByID

public static Building getBuildingByID(int id)
Returns the building specified by id. If there are two buildings with id, only one of them is returned. No guarantee of this is given in future versions. As the id should be unique, this gives the possibility to exactly identify buildings and - provided a consistent source for buildings exists, store buildings over program starts and shutdowns.

Parameters:
id - The ID the building given back has.
Returns:
The building specified by id or null if no such building exists.

getGroundFloor

public Map getGroundFloor()
Returns the building's ground floor as a Map object. This should be equivalent to getFloors().get(getGroundFloorIndex).

Returns:
the building's ground floor

getAllBuildings

public static List<Building> getAllBuildings()
Returns a list containing all buildings.

Returns:
a list containing all buildings.
